thread.title: Benedict Cumberbatch's Sherlock Australian cinema dates confirmed
thread.title_full: Benedict Cumberbatch's Sherlock Australian cinema dates confirmed

author: Scott Ellis
title: Benedict Cumberbatch's Sherlock Australian cinema dates confirmed
text:

Trailer: Sherlock - The Abominable Bride Sherlock Christmas special titled The Abominable Bride sees Cumberbatch's Holmes and sidekick Martin Freeman (as Watson) transported back in time to Victorian England. 
PT0M29S http://www.canberratimes.com.au/action/externalEmbeddedPlayer?id=d-453yz 620 349 October 25, 2015 - 12:44PM Autoplay On Off Video feedback Video settings Fans of the Benedict Cumberbatch's Sherlock will get to see their hero on the big screen with the Christmas special slated for cinema release.
The BBC has confirmed Sherlock:The Abominable Bride , which sees Cumberbatch's Holmes and sidekick Martin Freeman (as Watson) transported back in time to Victorian England, will be screened at selected cinemas on January 2, shortly after its premiere on streaming service Stan*.
As well as the In 90-minute feature, the cinema release will include "bonus material" of the kind usually found in DVD extras, such as a guided tour of Holmes' home at 221B Baker Street from series co-creator Steven Moffat and a look behind the scenes at the making of the episode.
Benedict Cumberbatch in Sherlock: The Abominable Bride . Sherlock Special_1.jpg 
Details of the time-shifted episode have been kept under wraps, but it has been hinted this will be "a ghoulish adventure â€¦ that will push (Holmes and Watson) to the limit"
Advertisement The trailer teases that the case is part of a bigger "war".
"The stage is set, the curtain rises, we are ready to begin," Cumberbatch says over the opening moments of the trailer.
Images from Sherlock: The Abominable Bride Photo: Supplied 
"We all have a past, Watson. Ghosts. They're the shadows that define our every sunny day. Every great cause has martyrs.
"Every war has suicide missions and make no mistake this is war."
Earlier this year Steven Moffat told fans at ComicCon the episode would surprise.
"Sherlock on the big screen," Moffat told an audience at ComicCon earlier this year, "For us, it's a giant leap backwards - into Victorian London. The mean streets of 1895 have never looked so good."
Sherlock: The Abominable Bride  premieres on Stan on Saturday, January 2. Tickets for the cinema release will be available at participating theatres from October 30.
Stan* is jointly owned by Fairfax Media and Channel Nine.
